snippet: Larossi Abballa, who stabbed a police captain and his companion to death, was released almost immediately after his conviction in 2013.
abstract: Frenchman Larossi Abballa fatally stabs police officer and his female companion in town of Magnanville, then posts video of himself on Facebook declaring allegiance to Islamic State; couple's son is rescued following police raid in which Abballa is killed; attacks, coming just after Orlando shooting, illustrate possibility of home-grown extremists acting in name of terrorist organizations in ordinary places, and difficulty of predicting such incidents.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and LILIA BLAISE
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Daphné Anglès, Rukmini Callimachi, Benoît Morenne and Milan Schreuer from Paris, and Sewell Chan from London.

lead_paragraph: Larossi Abballa, who stabbed a police captain and his companion to death, was released almost immediately after his conviction in 2013.

headline.main: Killing Twice for ISIS and Saying So Live on Facebook
headline.print_headline: Frenchman Kills 2 in ISIS’ Name and Says So Live on Facebook

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
